intro: Chomelia socleana, commonly known as the Socleana chomelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an attractive species for horticultural cultivation in warm climates.
